sys_metadata_link.payload: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?><record_update table="x_62500_mealplan_recipe"> <x_62500_mealplan_recipe action="INSERT_OR_UPDATE"> <active>true</active> <cook_time/> <cooking_instructions>1. Heat olive oil and butter in a pan over medium heat. 2. Add minced garlic, minced ginger, and chopped green chili. Cook until fragrant. 3. Add chopped onion and cook until translucent. 4. Stir in chopped capsicum and cook until softened. 5. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until soft. 6. Add boiled and mashed potatoes, cauliflower, carrot, and peas. Mix well. 7. Stir in pav bhaji masala, lemon juice, salt, and pepper. 8. Cook for 10-15 minutes, mashing the vegetables with a potato masher. 9. Garnish with fresh coriander. 10. Toast pav with butter. 11. Serve hot with pav and chopped onions.</cooking_instructions> <cuisine display_value="Indian">8f495a179791021069a3b6fce053afcf</cuisine> <diet>bca1c6979711021069a3b6fce053af90</diet> <effort display_value="Moderate">bee0a76e9730021069a3b6fce053af3e</effort> <image/> <ingredients>Potatoes (2, boiled and mashed), Caulifl</ingredients> <meal_type display_value="Dinner">ca8516df9751021069a3b6fce053afdf</meal_type> <name>Pav Bhaji</name> <nutrition>Calories: 300, Protein: 10g, Fat: 15g, Carbs: 40g</nutrition> <owned_by/> <pre_cook>false</pre_cook> <prep_instructions>1. Boil and mash potatoes, cauliflower, carrot, and peas. 2. Chop capsicum, tomato, onion, garlic, ginger, and green chili.</prep_instructions> <prep_required>false</prep_required> <prep_time/> <serving>2</serving> <sys_created_by>admin</sys_created_by> <sys_created_on>2024-04-07 01:22:04</sys_created_on> <sys_id>b891d71f9795021069a3b6fce053afdf</sys_id> <sys_mod_count>0</sys_mod_count> <sys_updated_by>admin</sys_updated_by> <sys_updated_on>2024-04-07 01:22:04</sys_updated_on> <time_of_day/> </x_62500_mealplan_recipe> </record_update>
